channel.title: devops on Tiago on tech
channel.description: Recent content in devops on Tiago on tech

item.title: Replace your docker with 3 easy steps
item.description: I don’t like managing servers. This is a well-known fact. My way around it was to set up all my apps using docker, and that made me happy. After my small server ran out of space with only 5 web apps running, I started changing my mind. On top of this, I used GitHub actions with azure, and loved it. For that reason I moved my dotnet webapp from docker to a Linux service automatically deployed by github actions.

item.title: Certbot
item.description: my certificate is expired and certbot This gives me a message “your current client, does not support ACME v2 at all. You will need to migrate to a different one”, but there is nothing I can do to update my certbot. So I did some googling around, and found nothing that helped me. It is worth to note that this was in an old server with ubuntu 17. Now there is one thing I can do: remove it and install it again!
